1 /**
  2   @typedef {Object} EncryptInfo
  3   @static
  4   @property {Object} key JWK AES key.
  5   @property {string} iv Base64 encoded AES IV.
  6   @property {Object} hashes The SHA-256 hash of the encrypted attachment.
  7  */
  8 
  9 /**
 10   @typedef {Object} EncryptResult
 11   @property {ArrayBuffer} data The encrypted data buffer.
 12   @property {EncryptInfo} info The information needed to decrypt the attachment.
 13  */
 14 
 15 /**
 16  * Encrypt an attachment.
 17  * @param {ArrayBuffer} plaintextBuffer The attachment data buffer.
 18  * @return {Promise} A promise that resolves with a {@link EncryptResult} when the attachment is encrypted.
 19  */
 20 function encryptAttachment(plaintextBuffer) {
 21     var cryptoKey; // The AES key object.
 22     var exportedKey; // The AES key exported as JWK.
 23     var ciphertextBuffer; // ArrayBuffer of encrypted data.
 24     var sha256Buffer; // ArrayBuffer of digest.
 25     var ivArray; // Uint8Array of AES IV
 26     // Generate a random IV.
 27     ivArray = window.crypto.getRandomValues(new Uint8Array(16));
 28     // Load the encryption key.
 29     return window.crypto.subtle.generateKey(
 30         {"name": "AES-GCM", length:256}, true, ["encrypt", "decrypt"]
 31     ).then(function(generateKeyResult) {
 32         cryptoKey = generateKeyResult;
 33         // Export the Key as JWK.
 34         return window.crypto.subtle.exportKey("jwk", cryptoKey);
 35     }).then(function(exportKeyResult) {
 36         exportedKey = exportKeyResult;
 37         // Encrypt the input ArrayBuffer.
 38         return window.crypto.subtle.encrypt(
 39             {name: "AES-GCM", iv: ivArray}, cryptoKey, plaintextBuffer
 40         );
 41     }).then(function(encryptResult) {
 42         ciphertextBuffer = encryptResult;
 43         // SHA-256 the encrypted data.
 44         return window.crypto.subtle.digest("SHA-256", ciphertextBuffer);
 45     }).then(function (digestResult) {
 46         sha256Buffer = digestResult;
 47 
 48         return {
 49             data: ciphertextBuffer,
 50             info: {
 51                 key: exportedKey,
 52                 iv: encodeBase64(ivArray),
 53                 hashes: {
 54                     sha256: encodeBase64(new Uint8Array(sha256Buffer)),
 55                 },
 56             },
 57         };
 58     });
 59 }
 60 
 61 /**
 62  * Decrypt an attachment.
 63  * @param {ArrayBuffer} ciphertextBuffer The encrypted attachment data buffer.
 64  * @param {EncryptInfo} info The information needed to decrypt the attachment.
 65  * @return {Promise} A promise that resolves with an {@link ArrayBuffer} when the attachment is decrypted.
 66  */
 67 function decryptAttachment(ciphertextBuffer, info) {
 68     var cryptoKey; // The AES key object.
 69     var ivArray = decodeBase64(info.iv);
 70     var expectedSha256base64 = info.hashes.sha256;
 71     // Load the AES from the "key" key of the info object.
 72     return window.crypto.subtle.importKey(
 73         "jwk", info.key, {"name": "AES-GCM"}, false, ["encrypt", "decrypt"]
 74     ).then(function (importKeyResult) {
 75         cryptoKey = importKeyResult;
 76         // Check the sha256 hash
 77         return window.crypto.subtle.digest("SHA-256", ciphertextBuffer);
 78     }).then(function (digestResult) {
 79         if (encodeBase64(new Uint8Array(digestResult)) != expectedSha256base64) {
 80             throw new Error("Mismatched SHA-256 digest");
 81         }
 82         return window.crypto.subtle.decrypt(
 83             {name: "AES-GCM", iv: ivArray}, cryptoKey, ciphertextBuffer
 84         );
 85     });
 86 }
 87 
 88 /**
 89  * Encode a typed array of uint8 as base64.
 90  * @param {Uint8Array} uint8Array The data to encode.
 91  * @return {string} The base64 without padding.
 92  */
 93 function encodeBase64(uint8Array) {
 94     // Misinterpt the Uint8Array as Latin-1.
 95     var latin1String = String.fromCharCode.apply(null, uint8Array);
 96     // Use the builtin base64 encoder.
 97     var paddedBase64 = window.btoa(latin1String);
 98     // Calculate the unpadded length.
 99     var inputLength = uint8Array.length;
100     var outputLength = 4 * (((inputLength + 2) / 3) | 0) + (inputLength + 2) % 3 - 2;
101     // Return the unpadded base64.
102     return paddedBase64.slice(0, outputLength);
103 }
104 
105 /**
106  * Decode a base64 string to a typed array of uint8.
107  * @param {string} base64 The unpadded base64 to decode.
108  * @return {Uint8Array} The decoded data.
109  */
110 function decodeBase64(base64) {
111     // Pad the base64 up to the next multiple of 4.
112     var paddedBase64 = base64 + "===".slice(0, (4 - base64.length % 4) % 4);
113     // Decode the base64 as a misinterpted Latin-1 string.
114     var latin1String = window.atob(paddedBase64);
115     // Encode the string as a Uint8Array as Latin-1.
116     var uint8Array = new Uint8Array(latin1String.length);
117     for (var i = 0; i < latin1String.length; i++) {
118         uint8Array[i] = latin1String.charCodeAt(i);
119     }
120     return uint8Array;
121 }
122 
123 try {
124     exports.encrypt = encrypt;
125     exports.decrypt = decrypt;
126 }
127 catch (e) {
128     // Ignore unknown variable "exports" errors when this is loaded directly into a browser
129 }
130
